title: Czech Republic: Citibank Clients are the First to Make Real-Time Electronic Payments Abroad
summary: Prague – As of this week, clients of Czech Citibank can use a new service called Citibank Global Transfer, which allows them to transfer funds between Citibank accounts across the globe without a time lag. Funds are credited to the recipient's account abroad within few seconds, and payments are submitted directly via Citibank online internet banking.
tag-1: Czech Republic: Citibank Clients are the First to Make Real-Time Electronic Payments Abroad
tag-2: Prague – As of this week, clients of Czech Citibank can use a new service called Citibank Global Transfer, which allows them to transfer funds between Citibank accounts across the globe without a time lag. Funds are credited to the recipient's account abroad within few seconds, and payments are submitted directly via Citibank online internet banking.
tag-3: Citibank is the only bank on the Czech market that offers clients this type of service. At the moment, funds can be sent to and received in 27 countries all over the world, and this network is constantly expanding.
tag-4: "Citibank Global Transfer is a service available exclusively to retail clients of Citibank. Citigold clients are offered this service at no charge, and other clients are charged a fee of 100 CZK per outgoing transaction. All incoming transactions are free of charge," specifies Petr Rehák, Retail Bank Head at Citibank.
tag-5: Compared to standard methods of funds transfer, the new service offers Citibank clients many benefits, including instant access to the funds sent abroad. Transfers are simple and do not require a great deal of paper work for customers.
tag-6: "We are pleased to continue to fulfill our ambition to bring innovative services leveraging our global presence that enhance our clients' overall banking experience," adds Bhaskar Katta, Consumer Bank Head at Citibank.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
